alert.note: Alert for Gadsden; Jackson (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Jackson, northeastern Gadsden, Decatur, southern Grady, south central Miller and Seminole Counties through 600 PM EDT/500 PM CDT/... At 515 PM EDT/415 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Donalsonville to near Whigham. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Colquitt, Bainbridge, Donalsonville, Cairo, Whigham, West Bainbridge, Attapulgus, Iron City, Climax, Brinson, Hanover, Ausmac, Reynoldsville, Darsey, Little Hope, Decatur Co A/P, Laingkat, Calvary, Boykin and Princes Still. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
